ch.zhaw.iamp.rct.graph

Class NetworkGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.zhaw.iamp.rct.graph.NetworkGraph

  • public class NetworkGraph
extends Object
    A NetworkGraph represents a robot arm with a mass-spring network attached to it.
    See Also:
    Mass, Spring

      NetworkGraph()

        public NetworkGraph()

    • Method Detail

      • addMasses

        public void addMasses(Mass... masses)
        Adds the given masses to the graph. They are added in the order how they are given.
        Parameters:
        masses - At least one mass to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If at least one argument is null.

      • getMasses

        public List<Mass> getMasses()
        Returns:
        A list of all masses, including shoulder, elbow, hand.

      • getNetworkMasses

        public List<Mass> getNetworkMasses()
        Returns:
        A list of all masses of the network.

      • getInputs

        public List<Mass> getInputs()
        Gets the input nodes ordered by the distance between the shoulder (ascending). The first element of the result is the input node nearest to the shoulder, the second is second nearest, and so forth.

        Ideally that will lead to a order, where the input nodes are directly usable as they appear on the robot arm.

        Returns:
        The list of input nodes as described above, or an empty list, if no input nodes are available.

      • getShoulder

        public Mass getShoulder()
        Gets the shoulder.
        Returns:
        The shoulder or null, if not configured.

      • getElbow

        public Mass getElbow()
        Gets the elbow.
        Returns:
        The elbow or null, if not configured.

      • getHand

        public Mass getHand()
        Gets the hand.
        Returns:
        The hand or null, if not configured.

      • findReachableMassesAndInputs

        public List<Mass> findReachableMassesAndInputs(Mass mass,
                                      Range range,
                                      boolean excludeCrossings)
        Finds all masses in this graph that are in range to the given mass, of the Mass.Type INPUT or NETWORK, and are directly reachable, without crossing springs between them an the given mass.
        Parameters:
        mass - The mass form which should be searched. This mass has to be in this graph.
        range - The range/ring around this mass in which should be searched.
        excludeCrossings - If set to true, it will be checked if a new spring crosses any existing springs. Such springs will not be generated.
        Returns:
        The list of masses in range. The list is empty, if no masses in range can be found.

      • addSpring

        public void addSpring(Mass source,
             Mass destination)
        Adds a new spring with the given source and destination to the graph.
        Parameters:
        source - The source mass.
        destination - The destination mass.

      • getSprings

        public List<Spring> getSprings()

      • getSprings

        public List<Spring> getSprings(Mass mass)
        Get all Springs, the given Mass is connected to. Thereby, it is does not matter if the given Mass is the source or the destination of a Spring.
        Parameters:
        mass - The mass, to which all connected Springs should be returned.
        Returns:
        The connected springs or an empty List, if no Spring is connected to the given Mass.

      • hasSpringBetweenMasses

        public boolean hasSpringBetweenMasses(Mass mass1,
                             Mass mass2)
        Tests whether a connection between the given masses exists or not. The direction respectively the order of the parameters does not matter.
        Parameters:
        mass1 - The one mass of the possible connection.
        mass2 - The other mass of the possible connection.
        Returns:
        true, if there is a connection, false otherwise.

      • removeNotConnectedNetworkMasses

        public void removeNotConnectedNetworkMasses()
        Removes all not connected masses of the mass-spring network.

      • removeMassSpringNetwork

        public void removeMassSpringNetwork()
        Removes the entire mass-spring network of this graph. This does not affect the robot arm.

      • reset

        public void reset()
